context/5: I can tell you got good taste.
context/6: You take this room for instance.
context/7: You'd be surprised at some of the things I see.
context/9: You know, people go through life with their eyes closed.

context: If you're so worried about Mom, go on home.
response: A couple of kids up there.
context/0: Ma'll skin up if we're late for supper.
context/1: We ought to be getting home.
context/2: I want one.
context/3: Who wants an old crow anyway?
context/4: Look at those feathers flying around.
context/5: Hey, you missed him again.
context/6: Ditch the car whilst I change clothes.
context/7: Going back to the same hideout.
context/8: Where we're going, they'll never look for us.

context: Don´t you ever think about them?
response: Lock them up...or better yet... let them come down, that way they´ll see that there are brave men.
context/2: Dueling is forbidden
context/4: I don´t know what´s so shocking to you
context/5: We have always held duels in this house.
context/6: I will never allow it in my house!
context/7: It´s Pablo Aguirre, the man who came last night and danced with Ana white as marble, he already had dead in his gaze.

context: Here, use these.
response: They were after guns and ammunition.
context/2: I am from Texas.
context/3: Only if it's a Northern soldier trying to sneak into Texas as a spy.
context/4: Do you ask everyone the same thing?
context/5: What for?
context/6: I'd like a canteen of water
context/8: Have you had any Indian trouble here?

context: Now, mister.
response: Careful where you point that gun.
context/0: I made that up to make her go.
context/2: I'll be there in a minute.
context/5: Stella!
context/7: It let all my feelings loose.
context/8: When I saw you come riding in, it was like a dam bursting.
context/9: In my heart I've never been his wife

context: Only one thing left, drop on them plane and all.
response: We're diving on the first one.
context/2: The giant arm raised, green flash, they're spraying us with flame.
context/3: 1,000 yards and we'll be over the first, 800 yards, 600, 400, 200, there they go.
context/5: The switchboard operator's are about ready to go out of their minds.
context/8: Well, it's three minutes until the break.
context/9: Tell them it's just a dramatization.

context: This is Dr. Frank Renault.
response: I'd like to talk to Mrs. Edward Davenport, please.
context/2: I'm sick.
context/3: Well, get him over here right away.
context/5: Dr. Renault.
context/6: Who's the nearest doc around here?
context/7: This is Mr. Davenport in Cabin 6.

context: I've been thinking about it and an idea came to me just now.
response: Oh, really?
context/1: I doubt if they ever will.
context/2: No, nor has anybody else.
context/3: Well, seen anything of the murderer?
context/5: Oh, it's you.
